intro: Paepalanthus conduplicatus var. conduplicatus, commonly known as the clustered arrowroot, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges, and is characterized by its grass-like appearance with narrow, linear leaves. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense mats, contributing to soil stabilization in its native habitat.
